Package org.funcito.mode

Mode and TypedMode interfaces and core implementations.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Mode
    The execution of every functor object created by a Funcito factory method is guided by an instance of either a standard Mode (this interface) or its cousin TypedMode.
    TypedMode<V>
    The execution of every functor object created by a Funcito factory method is guided by an instance of either a standard Mode or its cousin, TypedMode (this interface).
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Modes
    A convenience class of static methods for creating/providing Modes and TypedModes.
    NoOp
    This Mode provides a plain, unadorned BasicFunctor
    SafeNav
    This Mode provides a SafeNavFunctor with an implicit null default value
    TailDefault<V>
    This TypedMode provides a typed TailDefaultFunctor with an explicit default value
    TypedSafeNav<V>
    This TypedMode provides a typed SafeNavFunctor with an explicit default value
    ValidateNullBoolean
    This mode is internally used by Funcito for 3rd party APIs with primitive boolean-returning predicates, returning a NullValidatingPredicate that will help diagnose execution problems rather than simply throwing NullPointerException deep in the Funcito internals.

Package org.funcito.mode Description

Mode and TypedMode interfaces and core implementations. Users may create custom implementations of the Mode and TypedMode interfaces to control the execution of functors built by Funcito's factory methods.
